page.title: 03Longhorsley Area
page.content: This is an area of undulating land in mid-Nothumberland which gradually rises towards the north-west. This western area is predominantly rough grazing but as the land becomes lower it is used for more arable crops such as linseed rape and cereals. Longhorsley, a small rural village, is the largest settlement in the area. Until recently it was primarily a farming community but is becoming increasingly used as a dormitory village. There is a hamlet at Linden Hall formerly a large country home, now a four star hotel. The houses here are mainly used for estate or hotel workers. The remaining settlements are isolated cottages or farms. The area is bisected by the A697, the Morpeth to Coldstream road, so that the quiet Longhorsley village becomes very busy with through traffic.
